Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Pamela T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the YWCA Anne Black Guest House in Kowloon. First, the rooms are very basic and the furniture adequate but worn. The facility is very clean but there is no ambiance to speak of. The surrounding streets are busy and I did find it noisy at night. The bed was hard, and the blinds bent. Having said that, the room was very clean and had a wash basin, television, air conditioning, and toiletries. There was a guest booklet in the room with helpful information, and the linens included washcloths and towels that were very fresh. The womens toilet and shower area is locked and clean, so the "shared bathroom" was not traumatic. The hotel has public internet and laundry machines which can be used for a fee; a pay phone, and an adjacent cafe. The building is on a short, steep hill and not wheelchair accessible. It is within a block of buses (including one that will take the traveler to Victoria Harbor and the Star Ferry) and shopping that includes a Western-style grocery store. Although there are hotels and many restaurants in the area, I did not see many Westerners, so I ate, bused, and shopped among locals or Asian guests. Within walking distance are the tight, narrow streets filled with neon signs and street vendors, as well as a Post Office, McDonald's and Nathan Road. I got a discount card for the adjacent cafe but there was no breakfast plan at this facility. The front desk personnel spoke English and was efficient, even ordering an airport shuttle for me when I left. Except for the hard bed, I was very happy with my stay there and would recommend the Anne Black and the adjoining cafe for anyone who wanted the kind of experience I did, that is, to experience Asia for the first time with adequate English support but without segregating myself with Westerners.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value mid rande jotel”
Reviews.Author: BooBoo007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 8 year old daughter in October 2010 for 2 weeks. A great choice as we were there to sight see and shop and not swoon in a hotel. The rooms were a decent size, clean and new. We had a nice little view from our room and a swim in the roof pool on occasion. Breakfast was included in our package and the standard was good. A decent choice. My only gripe was that they closed the doors about 10:00am, and as hong kong is a night life place, it's hard to be up and about by 10am as you generally sleep in. Yes the location is a bit 'up there', but my advice is utilise the taxi cabs. They're cheap and faster than the buses. It's a quieter part of town up in the mid levels and a walk through the park/zoo is a nice break and convenient. I definitely recommend this hotel particularly if you want your own room and space and are a bit beyond the whole back packer scene.

Reviews.Title: “YWCA, Hong Kong, China”
Reviews.Author: rsp103
Reviews.Content: YWCA in Hong Kong China only supplies bath towels; not hand towels or wash cloths. Our AC is turned off when housekeeping cleans the room so we came back to a hot hotel room. With our on-line reservation stating "bathroom to share" we were surprised to find out they meant with other customers up to 14 possible and not just your traveling companion. We ended up paying extra because we didn't want to share the bathroom with the whole floor. Paint was peeling from the ceiling as I laid in bed. Only positive thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-level hotel”
Reviews.Author: EthanandJocelyn
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong isn't cheap and if you would like to avoid the backpacker haunts, the YWCA is one option. It also isn't cheap, but for the price, you get a decent room with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Hong kong secret”
Reviews.Author: jchc79
Reviews.Content: Staying for 5 nights whilst at a conference I found this to be a very quiet ,clean and remarkably well priced hotel from a hong kong perspective cabs are plentiful and cost about $us3 to get around central the supermarket next door has everything required my only complaint is that wifi is only avaiable in the lobby and costs about $us12 a day but this is a small expense when compared to the hotels down in central

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, quiet, friendly, inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: solotravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in November 2011. Clean and quiet room, very friendly staff throughout the hotel, large room. This is a fairly new and very well kept property. Taxi ride from central station downtown is HKG $23 (about USD $3) - taxi is essential to get to the hotel because it is a steep uphill climb otherwise. Breakfast buffet is very good, there is a wide selection of both Asian and Western breakfast offerings. Internet (about USD $5 a day) is sluggish, that is my only complaint. Internet service is by cable (Ethernet), bring your own cable, or, the staff at the front desk will loan you one. All in all, excellent value and a great location in Hong Kong. I'll come back and I have no hesitation recommending this hotel to others. Despite the "YWCA" name, guests are about an equal mix of men and women.

Reviews.Title: “Good Tidy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Craig O
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days at YWCA at Mid Levels, was a bit of a hike to get to, but that is probably our fault for not getting a taxi. Room was nice, and have a really beautiful view of the city and Zoo. Was located near a supermarket, so it was easy to get anything we wanted for breakfast. Rooms walls were a bit thin, as we could here the neighbours TV some times, but it was a plesent experience..

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic nice room”
Reviews.Author: drake63
Reviews.Content: centrally located, at mid level across the city zoo and flower gardens, I was very pleasantly surprise the cleanleiness of the room, it offered the basic modern convience , flat screen tv. nice bathroom, and yes a very firm bed/ but overall it was good experience, and the location we were able to walk from here or catch a cheap cab, food market was just a block away

Reviews.Title: “it is middle class hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: sunnytheking
Reviews.Content: dt : 10 oct 2009 we have seen this hotel location by tripadvisor and booked this hotel because of it's location and good hotel rate as compared to others hotel rate. it is very well situated with good ventilation. it is like a hostel with common bathroom. Facilities are medium. services are normal.

Reviews.Title: “Basic option for Mid Levels”
Reviews.Author: UkWoodside
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the name - this is a good budget hotel suitable for all in a good location. Mid Levels isn't at the centre of the action, but it is easy to catch a (cheap) cab to anywhere on the island. Rooms are small, beds are hard, there aren't many frills, but it is clean and good value. Some of the rooms have good views. Location is just across the road from the botanical gardens and zoo (don't go looking for the resident jaguar - it is now dead, and on display but stuffed!). Breakfast is fine. Decent sized pool is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “A long stay in the YWCA”
Reviews.Author: Sandy055
Reviews.Content: I stayed in de YWCA Hong Kong for 2 and a half months, during a long stay in HK. My stay was fine, its not an all service hotel, they make your room, and the front desk is friendly, but dont expect much. I think its the only service apartment in HK. Our room/apartment was large for HK, small for the US, King Bed, nice plain decoration, not a lot storage space (dont bring to many things!) small fridge, coffee maker, etc... My room had the greatest view of HK, but I saw many rooms with buildings in front. Its a great place to sleep, clean, and very reasonable for HK sizes. Very centric. I wanted to mention that beside the gym, there is a cafe run by a mental handicap association, which I found so nice. They are training young adults to be independent and find a job, so if you are visiting, you should give it a try. The food is good, and the volunteers and students make your lunch very much enjoyable! I really felt they are making a great job.

HotelInfo.Name: YWCA Building
HotelInfo.Address: No.38C Bonham Road, Mid-Levels, Hong Kong, China
